metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Learn how to create tabs with CSS and JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create tabs with CSS and JavaScript.

content.text: Tabs are perfect for single page web applications, or for web pages capable of displaying different subjects:
content.html: Tabs are perfect for single page web applications, or for web pages capable of displaying different subjects:

content.text: London is the capital city of England.
content.html: London is the capital city of England.

content.text: Paris is the capital of France.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

content.code:
London

 

London is the capital city of England.

 

Paris

 

Paris is the capital of France.

 

Tokyo

 

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
content.code_html:
<!-- Tab links -->
<div class="tab">
  <button class="tablinks" onclick="openCity(event, 'London')">London</button>
  <button class="tablinks" onclick="openCity(event, 'Paris')">Paris</button>
  <button class="tablinks" onclick="openCity(event, 'Tokyo')">Tokyo</button>
</div>

<!-- Tab content -->
<div id="London" class="tabcontent">
  <h3>London</h3>
  <p>London is the capital city of England.</p>
</div>

<div id="Paris" class="tabcontent">
  <h3>Paris</h3>
  <p>Paris is the capital of France.</p>
</div>

<div id="Tokyo" class="tabcontent">
  <h3>Tokyo</h3>
  <p>Tokyo is the capital of Japan.</p>
</div>

content.text: Create buttons to open specific tab content. All <div> elements with class="tabcontent" are hidden by default (with CSS & JS). When the user clicks on a button - it will open the tab content that "matches" this button.
content.html: Create buttons to open specific tab content. All <div> elements with class="tabcontent" are hidden by default (with CSS & JS). When the user clicks on a button - it will open the tab content that "matches" this button.

content.text: Style the buttons and the tab content:
content.html: Style the buttons and the tab content:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Style the buttons that are used to open the tab content */

background-color: inherit;  float: left;  
  border: none;  outline: none;  cursor: pointer;  padding: 14px 16px;  transition: 0.3s;

/* Change background color of buttons on hover 
  */
display: none;  padding: 6px 12px;  border: 1px solid #ccc;  border-top: none;

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Style the buttons that are used to open the tab content */

background-color: inherit;  float: left;  
  border: none;  outline: none;  cursor: pointer;  padding: 14px 16px;  transition: 0.3s;

/* Change background color of buttons on hover 
  */
display: none;  padding: 6px 12px;  border: 1px solid #ccc;  border-top: none;

content.code_html:
/* Style the tab */
.tab {
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
}

/* Style the buttons that are used to open the tab content */
.tab button {
  background-color: inherit;
  float: left;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  cursor: pointer;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  transition: 0.3s;
}

/* Change background color of buttons on hover */
.tab button:hover {
  background-color: #ddd;
}

/* Create an active/current tablink class */
.tab button.active {
  background-color: #ccc;
}

/* Style the tab content */
.tabcontent {
  display: none;
  padding: 6px 12px;
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  border-top: none;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Style the buttons that are used to open the tab content */

background-color: inherit;  float: left;  
  border: none;  outline: none;  cursor: pointer;  padding: 14px 16px;  transition: 0.3s;

/* Change background color of buttons on hover 
  */
display: none;  padding: 6px 12px;  border: 1px solid #ccc;  border-top: none;

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Get all elements with class="tabcontent" and hide them

// Get all elements with class="tablinks" and remove 
the class "active"

// Show the current tab, and add an "active" class to 
the button that opened the tab

syntax_highlighting.text: // Get all elements with class="tabcontent" and hide them

// Get all elements with class="tablinks" and remove 
the class "active"

// Show the current tab, and add an "active" class to 
the button that opened the tab

content.code_html:
function openCity(evt, cityName) {
  // Declare all variables
  var i, tabcontent, tablinks;

  // Get all elements with class="tabcontent" and hide them
  tabcontent = document.getElementsByClassName("tabcontent");
  for (i = 0; i < tabcontent.length; i++) {
    tabcontent[i].style.display = "none";
  }

  // Get all elements with class="tablinks" and remove the class "active"
   tablinks = document.getElementsByClassName("tablinks");
  for (i = 0; i < tablinks.length; i++) {
    tablinks[i].className = tablinks[i].className.replace(" active", "");
  }

  // Show the current tab, and add an "active" class to the button that opened the tab
   document.getElementById(cityName).style.display = "block";
  evt.currentTarget.className += " active";
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Get all elements with class="tabcontent" and hide them

// Get all elements with class="tablinks" and remove 
the class "active"

// Show the current tab, and add an "active" class to 
the button that opened the tab

content.text: If you want to fade in the tab content, add the following CSS:
content.html: If you want to fade in the tab content, add the following CSS:

syntaxHighlighting.text: animation: fadeEffect 1s; /* Fading effect takes 1 second */

/* Go 
  from zero to full opacity */

syntax_highlighting.text: animation: fadeEffect 1s; /* Fading effect takes 1 second */

/* Go 
  from zero to full opacity */

content.code_html:
.tabcontent {
  animation: fadeEffect 1s; /* Fading effect takes 1 second */
}

/* Go from zero to full opacity */
@keyframes fadeEffect {
  from {opacity: 0;}
  to {opacity: 1;}
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: animation: fadeEffect 1s; /* Fading effect takes 1 second */

/* Go 
  from zero to full opacity */

content.text: To open a specific tab on page load, use JavaScript to "click" on the specified tab button:
content.html: To open a specific tab on page load, use JavaScript to "click" on the specified tab button:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
 document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it

content.code:
<button class="tablinks" onclick="openCity(event, 'London')" id="defaultOpen">London</button>

<script>
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();</script>

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
 document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it

content.code_html:
<button class="tablinks" onclick="openCity(event, 'London')" id="defaultOpen">London</button>

<script>
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
 document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
 document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();
// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it

content.text: If you want to close a specific tab, use JavaScript to hide the tab with a click of a button:
content.html: If you want to close a specific tab, use JavaScript to hide the tab with a click of a button:

syntaxHighlighting.text: <!-- Click on the <span> element to close the tab -->

content.code:
London

 

London is the capital city of England.

  x

syntax_highlighting.text: <!-- Click on the <span> element to close the tab -->

content.code_html:
<!-- Click on the <span> element to close the tab -->

<div id="London" class="tabcontent">
  <h3>London</h3>
  <p>London is the capital city of England.</p>
  <span onclick="this.parentElement.style.display='none'">x</span>
</div>

syntax_highlighting_data.text: <!-- Click on the <span> element to close the tab -->

content.text: Tip: Also check out How To - Vertical Tabs .
content.html: Tip: Also check out How To - Vertical Tabs.
